title: 5 big things the movies get wrong about grenades
text:
1. Explosion radius.

A US Military Academy cadet shoots a M203 grenade launcher for the first time during Cadet Basic Training, July 31, 2018. U.S. Army photo by Michelle Eberhart

In general, movies would have you believe that grenades are just a step beneath MOABs. The reality of grenades is much like the reality of that online date you're about to go on. When you first see it in real life, your first thought is probably going to be, "that's it?"

It's not some huge, f--- off fireball, it's just a poof of smoke and shrapnel.

You should probably still stay away from it, though — both the date and the grenade.
description: Grenades are one of the most identifiable weapons US troops carry, but that doesn't mean they're well understood.
